image.altText: Victoria Police logo

items.synopsis: Police arrest a 14-year-old boy who they believe is the "principal offender" in an alleged violent abduction in Melbourne that left another teenager in hospital.

title.children: Teen arrested over alleged violent after-school attack that left 14yo with 'life-altering injuries'

image.altText: An aerial image of an industrial area which includes silos

items.synopsis: A siege that followed a fatal shooting in WA's Wheatbelt has ended with the 25-year-old gunman turning the weapon on himself.

title.children: Gunman dead following fatal workplace shooting and police stand-off

image.altText: Close up of Catherine King

items.synopsis: Transport Minister Catherine King has pledged airfares will soon come down, saying Qatar Airways is "not the only airline that adds to competition".

title.children: Catherine King says airfares 'will come down' as other airlines increase capacity

image.altText: Qatar Airways and Qantas planes on tarmac in Perth.

items.synopsis: This week delivered a brutal lesson in how a political perception problem can suddenly become a spectacular, fridge-melting conflagration, write Annabel Crabb and Brett Worthington.

title.children: At some point, love for Qantas died. What was the final straw?

image.altText: German defence officials climb on a Boxer army vehicle in australia

items.synopsis: Barely two months ago, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese announced a $1 billion Defence deal with Germany while visiting Berlin. But after that country missed out on a reciprocal contract, the relationship is now looking unlikely.

title.children: Growing doubts about German commitment to $1b Australian Army export deal

image.altText: A group of Collingwood AFL players embrace and celebrate after a goal.

items.synopsis: Collingwood has survived a late Melbourne charge to win a tense qualifying final by seven points in front of 92,000 fans at the MCG.

title.children: Collingwood holds on to win epic qualifying final over Melbourne

image.altText: An AFL player lies on a stretcher and is carted off with support staff around him.

items.synopsis: Collingwood may not be able to count on Brayden Maynard for the rest of the finals, after the defender is put on report for a collision that left Melbourne's Angus Brayshaw stretchered off the ground with concussion.

title.children: Maynard says sickening collision with Brayshaw was a 'footy act'

image.altText: Lowe is wearing a blue suit, looking straight into camera, sitting at a desk.

items.synopsis: RBA governor Philip Lowe says we could manage inflation better, and floated ideas on how to do that, while addressing "vitriol" directed his way, in final speech.

title.children: RBA governor Philip Lowe warns about future inflation, criticises 'personal attacks', in final speech

image.altText: Belinda and Kobee Huddy smile for a selfie.

items.synopsis: Early one May morning in 2019, 20-year-old Kobee Huddy was desperate for help. He called a mental health service for advice. Less than four hours later he would be dead – shot by police.

title.children: Did Kobee's cry for help kill him? How a knife-wielding mentally ill young man was fatally shot by police

image.altText: black and white photo of the exterior of the Kinchela Boys Home

items.synopsis: NSW Aboriginal Affairs Minister David Harris says he is working with survivors from the Kinchela Aboriginal Boys Training Home about the next steps following an archaeological search at the site.

title.children: NSW government confirms archaeological search at notorious Aboriginal boys home

image.altText: Bruce Bonyhady wearing a suit and tie and smiling.

items.synopsis: Federal, state and local governments should strike a new funding agreement to build “foundational supports” for people with disabilities in settings like schools and family centres to reduce the strain on the NDIS, according to the chair of an independent review of the scheme.

title.children: The keys areas the NDIS review chair is looking to reform

image.altText: Brownstones in Brooklyn, New York

items.synopsis: New York is making big changes to its short-term rental rules, but it's not the only major city to do so.

title.children: New York is cracking down on Airbnbs. Here's how The Big Apple and other cities are tackling short-term rentals

image.altText: Gary Mitchell and his students post for a 1972 school photograph.

items.synopsis: A Board of Inquiry looking into child sexual abuse allegations will focus on three teachers, including convicted paedophile Gary Arthur Mitchell, and 18 government schools in Victoria.

title.children: Victorian inquiry into historical child sexual abuse to investigate three teachers and 18 schools

image.altText: A map of metropolitan Melbourne with green and blue shading.

items.synopsis: Electric vehicles sales in Melbourne's outer suburbs are rising and residents say they are saving money, but there are still roadblocks for people getting into the market.

title.children: Electric vehicle uptake in Melbourne's outer suburbs is surging. See how your postcode compares

image.altText: A woman in a yellow jacket, a woman in a navy jacket sit on a green bench seat while a man stands and shouts

items.synopsis: The heated discussion over why Qatar Airways' bid to increase flights to Australia was rejected has left the government juggling excess political baggage, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: 'C'mon, guys, you know people are watching': When all hell broke loose in Question Time, an independent stood up

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Xi Jinping smiling and shaking hands

items.synopsis: The prime minister says he will travel to China to mark the 50th anniversary of former PM Gough Whitlam's historic visit to the country, also becoming the first Australian leader to go to China since 2016.

title.children: Albanese confirms China trip for later this year

image.altText: A large red billboard on a building on a busy street corner, with people walking past

items.synopsis: The South Australian government launches an advertising blitz in Melbourne's CBD, spruiking its business credentials, drawing a response from the Victorian Premier.

title.children: Battle lines drawn: SA government launches ad campaign interstate to lure Victorian businesses

image.altText: a photo of a person leaning against a street pole

items.synopsis: Following an Australian transgender content creator's claims that Channel Seven used two photographs of her in an episode of Spotlight without her consent, two more transgender people have come forward saying the same.

title.children: More transgender people accuse Channel Seven of using images of them without consent

image.altText: Missing man Keith, who went missing near Portland in Victoria, wearing a green shirt and in front of a white background

items.synopsis: Keith Lees, 70, has been missing since June after he was visited by police about the case.

title.children: Family appeal to Keith Lees to hand himself in over Meaghan Louise Rose murder investigation

image.altText: Sheep walking up a ramp

items.synopsis: Sheep producers are selling their poorest stock for as little as a few dollars a head as meat markets continue their freefall.

title.children: Sheep prices crash as farmers sell their poorest stock for as little as $1

image.altText: A man and woman smile.

items.synopsis: A drink driver was speeding on the wrong side of the road when he hit another car and killed a mother-of-three in the Adelaide Hills.

title.children: 'Grossly intoxicated' drink driver to spend at least five years in jail for killing woman

image.altText: logs on a river

items.synopsis: A father whose daughter died in a Lake Keepit boat crash last year tells a court the pain of her death is a hurt he has to live with every day, which he would not wish on anyone.

title.children: 'Beyond comprehension': Father speaks of anguish at losing daughter in Lake Keepit boat crash

image.altText: A group of men wearing suits

items.synopsis: Police allege the 61-year-old concealed a serious indictable offence after the incident on Friday night, where two people were killed in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: Father of alleged hit-and-run driver charged with hindering investigation into fatal Sydney crash

image.altText: A woman crouching looking up at a furry animal and patting it as its held by another person.

items.synopsis: The environment minister hopes to avoid more species becoming extinct due to feral cats, as a draft plan to contain the animals is released for consultation.

title.children: Federal government declares 'war' on feral cats

image.altText: An ambulance and a crashed car surrounded by emergency services

items.synopsis: A court hears the 33-year-old man was travelling at least 130 kilometres per hour in the lead-up to the crash which killed two children.

title.children: Sydney man weeps in court after being denied bail over crash that killed two young boys

image.altText: The website for eHarmony, which has a picture of a smiling blonde, white woman

items.synopsis: eHarmony is hit with a lawsuit by the consumer watchdog, alleging the dating site breached Australian consumer law by making misleading statements about the pricing, renewal and cancellation of its memberships.

title.children: Nishan hasn't used eHarmony for 20 months but hasn't been able to remove himself from its billing cycle

image.altText: A huge plume of smoke billows above a bushfire burning in grassland near a country road.

items.synopsis: The fire near Cecil Plains has burnt through about 1,000 hectares since it was sparked by lightning on Tuesday.

title.children: Bushfire raging in Queensland state forest jumps containment lines

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie standing outside

items.synopsis: In the border towns of Albury and Wodonga the region's hospital is split across two sites. The NSW and Victorian governments now agree the best option for improving services is to redevelop the existing facility.

title.children: New mega-hospital on greenfields site for Albury Wodonga off the table

image.altText: Close up of Alan Joyce

items.synopsis: Alan Joyce reportedly jets off with a substantial amount of cash and Qantas shares in his portfolio — but valid questions are being asked about whether he is entitled to all of it.

title.children: Qantas' board is under enormous pressure to scrap Alan Joyce's final payout. Could they actually do it?

image.altText: Mark sits at his desk with a screen and laptop open in front on him talking to someone on his mobile phone.

items.synopsis: This homelessness entry point was housing thousands of people last year, but as pandemic funding wanes, staff face an uphill battle to keep roofs over heads, while demand surges.

title.children: Mark knows property managers have to make 'harsh' calls. Now he's on the other side

image.altText: A small Pookila Mouse is sitting amongst shrubbery

items.synopsis: There are hopes the release of six Pookila mice into the wild in Victoria will help boost numbers of the endangered species.

title.children: Endangered native mice released at Wilsons Promontory on a mission to save their species

image.altText: Relaxed anonymous male teenager texting on mobile phone. His face is obscured by his hands and mobile in front of him.

items.synopsis: Recently emojis have landed some people in legal trouble in courts around the world. So what constitutes crossing the line?

title.children: Don't underestimate the legal implications of a thumbs-up emoji — it cost a Canadian man $90,000

image.altText: Two police officers take a selfie photo with a smiling man and woman next to the ocean at sunset.

items.synopsis: After hearing a scream, Eric Krins and Maree Pearson did not hesitate to rush to the aid of the 67-year-old woman at a remote WA beach.

title.children: Byron Bay couple become holiday heroes with daring rescue of Ningaloo snorkeller 80m from shore

image.altText: A man in a dark corner putting his hands on a red brick wall and his feet on the opposite white wall floating above ground

items.synopsis: Police are flooding a search zone of increasingly worried residents in Philadelphia after revealing a killer escaped prison by scaling a wall and going undetected for an hour.

title.children: Murderer 'crab-walked' himself out of US prison, authorities reveal as seven-day manhunt drags on
